Posts.Content: Hello jreen, I just wanted to say two things. The first one is WOW !! that is indded GOOD NEWS !! I'm so happy for you. I'm sure you are over the moon with happiness and relief. I hope you remain cancer free.  Second, your original post is showing up on my account under 'my activity'. I don't how it got there. I wanted to know if other people can see it and if you know how to have it removed ? Anyway, all the best to you in the future !
Posts.Title: when do you just stop treatment

Posts.Content: On Jan 09, 2016 9:52 PMjgreen4wrote: Anyone with insight,.... My history is, I was first dx with breat cancer in 2000. Surg, chemo, rads. 2nd breast dx 2010. Bilateral mast, more chemo. 2 years later, uterine. Total hysterectomy.  One year later,  recurrence of uterine.  Rads, chemo.  Less than a year later I had to have a total pelvic exenteration due to massive radiation damage to abdominal organs. Present....I have wa told last week my last scan shows its very likely I have mets in the right lung. I'm seriously considering saying screw this I'm done. Only 53 yrs old with lots to live for but just wondering. ..when do you just have to give up? Do I stop beating this dead horse Have you thought about using alternative treatments ? Here are a few good websites.  http://www.chrisbeatcancer.com/why-i-didnt-do-chemo/ http://www.cancertutor.com/ There are more but this will get you started. Whatever you decide to do, I wish you all the best.
Posts.Title: when do you just stop treatment
